info.name: Exberry Admin API v1.45
info.description:
## General Exberry Admin API allows to manage the exchange static data (instruments, trading calendars and more) as well as sending operational commands (EOD, halt trading and more). Sandbox environment endpoint (`URL_ORIGIN`): `https://admin-api.uat.exberry-uat.io` Guidelines: - All numbers are stringified unless explicitly mentioned otherwise - Optional fields should be omitted from request if not required - System ignores any additional parameter that are sent on request body but was not specified in this document There is an option to enable the maker checker flow for selected actions. More information can be found [here](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/6229811/TzCV3jcq#2e9785a1-914f-44f3-8992-95569e495bf5). --- #### Error Handling Error response contains the following fields: | Name | Description | | --- | --- | | code | Error code | | message | Error message | | data.requiredPermission `optional` | Name of missing permission for that action | Error response sample: ``` json { "code": 10001, "message": "Permission denied", "data": { "requiredPermission": "Exchange/Instrument/create" } } ``` In case of wrong path, generic error will be returned: ``` json { "message": "Route not found", "code": 1 } ``` #### Generic Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | One of the below:
\- Timeout expired
\- Exchange is unavailable
\- Invalid JSON
\- Route not found
\- Maximum request size is 60kb | | 10000 | Invalid token | HTTP Error codes: 400: When exceeding Maximum request size of 60KB 403: Authentication and authorization related errors 401: Invalid token error 503: System is not available 504: Timeout 500: Any other error --- # API Changes ## v1.45.0(2025-06-25) - Added `longName` and `description` to the Market Participant ## v1.44.0(2025-06-11) - Changed `contractSize` field of the instrument to be optional for all catergories, with a precision upto 5 decimals and >0 - If not defined, `contractSize` is treated as 1 - Added `contractSizeUnit` as an optional field to the instrument - Added `description` as an optional field to the Account ## v1.43.0(2025-05-14) - Added Update API Key for MP and MP Groups with maker checker support - Deprecated `allowedInstruments` and `blockedInstruments` from API Keys - In Create/Update API Key, `cancelOnDisconnect` is mandatory when the API Key has `place_order` OR `submit_rfq_quotes` OR `create_trade_report` permissions, otherwise it is optional. API responses always return `cancelOnDisconnect` in the responses. - Before that, the system allowed setting `cancelOnDisconnect` only when an API Key has `place_order` permission (it was ignored in other cases). ## v1.42.0(2025-04-23) - Instrument Groups - Added Instrument Groups APIs - Added `groupIds` to the Instrument - Added supporting `instrumentGroupIds` to Trading Halt/Resume and CBRs - Added supporting `allowedInstrumentGroupIds` to the API Keys - Added maker checker `requestType` - Removed: Temporary error (to version 1.41.0 only) added in Halt/Resume API to validate NA is not used for category related filter: - Remove calendar.actionType property - Under Maker Checker section: - Added 2 `requestType`: `CreateAPIKey` , `DeleteAPIKey` - API creation samples were removed keeping only sample that have meaningful value - Fix documentation on the maker checker fields in response - Documentation only: - MP API: - "status" rather than "Status" - status can be only "Blocked" or empty - Update failure samples for apiKey actions ## v1.41.0(2025-03-11) - Added new `type` values to: - Trade Entry - Instrument.minQuantityTradeEntries - Instrument.tradingCutoffs - Added `OPG` and `ATC` values for auction.allowedTimeInForces - Allow to use Halt and Resume with filters, below error was removed: - `Filters are not allowed when Maker-Checker is enabled` - Temporary error (to version 1.41.0 only) added in Halt/Resume API to validate NA is not used for category related filter: - `Filters with "NA" category are not allowed when Maker-Checker is enabled` ## v1.40.0(2025-02-19) - The system retains and returns the tick size tables in a sorted ascending order by price. - marketStatus of the instruments with a startDate/stopDate, is kept in Closed until the startDate then change to Closed on the stopDate and and remain in Closed. - Introduction update: - Error Handling to be without not used properties - Remove multiple exchanges - Remove Generic error 10100 (Permission denied for exchange \[ExchangeID\]) - Get Calendars: results are now under calendars object , totalCount field added (This was already introduced on v1.39) - Get CBRs: totalCount field added - Get TickSizes: totalCount field added - Create API Key API (both for MP and MP Group): - Remove path property from error messages - Align error code to other entities (both application code as well as HTTP error code to 500) - From now on it is allowed to update reference price after EOD ## v1.39.0(2025-01-09) - Added supporting Replace reserve orders - Added supporting 00:00 for calendar marketClose time. - Typo fix: remove parties object from Replace order- Fields ## v1.38.0(2024-12-24) - Adding new validation to the auction - 102 - The auction duration in \[calendar\] is shorter than the minimum allowed duration - Added supporting ASCII (32 -126) characters for party.id and targetParty.id fields. - Added Market to Limit orders to the Place Order & Replace Order ## v1.37.0(2024-12-03) - Removed validation from Create CBR- 104 - Implied orders are configured for \[strategySymbol\] and are not supported for this CBR type - Added `legPriceBands` validation to `strategyType=STRIP2` Strip(Average Price) - Added `impliedOrderTypes` `IN` and `OUT` to `strategyType=STRIP2` Strip(Average Price) - Added supporting `applyCashDistribution` and `applySecurityDistribution` when there are active reserve orders - Added a validation to reject Replace and Cancel Order On Behalf requests for implied orders ## v1.36.0(2024-11-12) - Added `strategyType=STRIP2` Strip(Average Price) - Changed a `leg1ReferencePrice` validation. The field is mandatory only when `Category=K(Strategy)` AND `strategyType=SPREAD` and is optional when `Category=K(Strategy)` AND `strategyType!=SPREAD` - Added new validation to create & update instrument - 105 - Legs and Strategy calendars must be the same - Added new validation to trading halt & trading resume - 2004 - Filters are not allowed when Maker-Checker is enabled - Removed auction functionality from Instrument - Documented auction object validations in create calendar API ## v1.35.0(2024-10-21) - Added new fields and validations to "Trading Halt": - `scheduleResumeTime` - `scheduleResumeTimeInterval` - Added new types of CBR: - MARKET_RATE_POTENTIAL_EXECUTION - DYNAMIC_MARKET_RATE_POTENTIAL_EXECUTION - As a result also added new validations to the create instrument & create calendar - Added Reserve orders (iceberg and hidden) to the `Place Order` - Documented missing error code on instrument actions: `100` ## v1.34.0(2024-09-25) - Adding new field to the set settlement price - `updateReferencePrice` - Added `tradingCutoffs` for trade reporting - Added Candle Adjustments API as part of the "Corporate Actions" - The sorting in `get instruments` is now case-insensitive. - Added new validation to `Archive Instrument` ## v1.33.0(2024-08-21) - Added "Accounts API" folder under "MP API" - Added accounts related actions to the maker checker `requestType` - Added `accountId` to Create API Key - Added new APIs to adjust active orders and current market data fields(not historical) in case of Corporate Actions - `/api/operations/corporate-actions/apply-cash-distribution` - `/api/operations/corporate-actions/apply-security-distribution` - Support filter for `trading halt` and `trading resume` in the maker checker - Adding new TIF to auction - IOC - Adding new validation to `create calendar` ## v1.32.0(2024-08-07) - Changed the derivativeInstrumentCategory filter to filter only instruments that are active and that has an underlying instrument and is in this category, in: - Get Instruments - Trading Halt - Trading Resume - Added Suffix & Prefix for Symbol & Description filters - Added `cancelReason` to the - Cancel Order - Mass Cancel ## v1.31.0(2024-07-16) - Instruments API: - Change the status filter to be a list and rename it to statues. - Added a validation to prevent changing `quantityPrecision` & `pricePrecision` when active Alleged Trades exist. - Adding new filter and new values to filters in get instruments, halt and resume - product - new value - startDateFrom - new value - stopDateFrom - new value - derivativeInstrumentCategory - new filter - tradingHalt and tradingResume - Same changes mentioned above on instrument filters - Adding new validation to the halt & resume - 201 - You can send up to 750 instruments per request - Mass cancelation: - Added `AllegedTrade` to the `targetEntities` - Added `targetScope` to support cancellation across all instruments. - Adding new generic validation - 1 - Maximum request size is 60kb - Added cancellation of active Quotes and active Alleged Trades to the Cancel on Disconnect. - Added cancellation of active RFQs, Quotes and Alleged Trades when MP is blocked. ## v1.30.0(2024-06-19) - Adding `targetEntities` to Mass cancel - Adding optional fields to `get instruments` request to allow filtering - Adding more optional fields to `Trading Halt` and `Trading Resume` requests - Adding possibility for user to override the maker chaekcer flow - by super user with new permission - Adding new API to Archive Instrument - This action can be cofigured to require make/ checker process - Adding new activityStatus to get instrument - Adding new validations to instrument update : - Disabling an instrumentis not allowed when there are active/suspended orders or active RFQs/Quotes - Changing `quantityPrecision` & `pricePrecision` is not allowed when there are active/suspended orders or active RFQs/Quotes - Removed the comment field in the mass cancel. ## v1.29.0(2024-04-23) - Adding new Equilibrium Price matching algortihm for auctions - Adding the ability to configure `auctions.extensions` ## v1.28.0(2024-04-16) - Remove `marketStatus` and `tradingStatus` from the response of instrument API - Added `legPriceBands` to the instrument - Added new API- `place order` - Added new API - `replace order` ## v1.27.0(2024-04-01) - Remove from the response `latestTimestamp` of makerchecker request - Adding to the response `makerUserType` of makerchecker request - Changed the error message returned when configured mandatory parties are not in the Trade Entry - `tradingModels` field will always be included in the response of Create Update and Get Instrument - Adding new value to the maker checker `requestType` - `CancelOrder` - The `comment` in cancel order is now optional ## v1.26.0(2024-02-28) - Adding more requestTypes to the Maker Checker - Added support for removing `tradingModels` from instruments. - Added a validation to prevent the creation of strategies with strategy leg instruments. - Adding new API to the Operations API `Cancel Order` - Adding new field to thew CBR `rounding` ## v1.25.0 (2024-02-07) - Changed Update Instrument to allow changing the `stopDate` after the `startDate` - Adding the Maker Checker section ## v1.24.0 (2024-01-17) - Changed `compId(String)` of `MP` to `compIds(String[])` - Added `deliveryStartDate` and `deliveryEndDate` to the `Instrument` ## v1.23.0 (2023-12-26) - Bugfix to correct the error returned when updating quantity/price precision of a parent strategy instrument. Error before the fix:`Legs [price | quantity] precision must be equal to strategy price precision`, error after the fix: `[FieldName] can't be changed for strategy related instrument` - Change the Underlying Instrument of O(Option), F(Futures) and K(Strategies) instruments to Optional. - Adding new optional fields to the MP APIs to support Self-Trade Prevention. ## v1.21.0 (2023-11-20) - Adding sorting to Auction objects in calendar objects - Adding a new validation to PricePrecision and QuantityPrecision of strategy instruments(to validate that the same precision exists between parent and leg instruments). ## 2023-10-03 - Deprecate v1 Calendar and V1 Instrument ## 2023-09-19 - Adding new list to the instrument API- **minQuantityTradeEntries** - Adding new validation to the trade entry - 102 (to consider minQuantityTradeEntries) ## 2023-08-08 - Adding targetParties to order mass cancel - Adding the contractSize to the validation in create and update instrument - 101- Precision of \[Fieldname\] is greater than \[quantityPrecision\] - Adding edge case to the CBR ## 2023-07-12 - Adding the strike and coupon to the validations in create and update instrument - 101- Precision of \[Fieldname\] is greater than \[quantityPrecision\] - 101- \[FieldName\] must be less than or equal to maxLong/10^ fieldPrecision ## 2023-06-06 - Auction changes: - Adding seconds to start time - New field- overrideReferencePrice - CBR Additions: - New type of CBR that monitor market rate changes since the previous trade rate (last price). - New actionType: RESUME_AUCTION - Adding new validation to the create TickSize - Changing bonds paramters values ## 2023-04-23 - Adding new APIs: - TickSize - CBR ## 2023-03-22 - New subCategory - Bonds - New underlyingAssets - New optional fields in instruments ## 2023-02-13 - Added available values for: - categoty - subCategory - underlyingAssets ## 2023-02-08 - new API permission in MP and MP Group - New Operations API allows to: - Trading Halt - Trading Resume - Mass cancel ## 2023-01-18 - **IMPORTANT!** New response on MP Group - MP name max length = 30 - In MP and MPGroup for name and compId fields will have ASCII (32 -126) chars only ## 2023-01-03 - New field in auction- trigger ## 2022-12-06 - New strategy- strips - Cancel On Disconnect flag in apiKey ## 2022-11-21 - Trade Entry- response tradeId - Instrument symbol- allowed ^/= characters - New optional fields in the instrument for spreads strategy ## 2022-10-30 - New optional fields in instrument API - Instrument API- quoteCurrency is now limited to 10 characters - End of day trigger - MP status (Active/ Blocked) ## 2022-10-03 - New APIKeys permission- **MP** **How it was-** - Market Data - Trading - Mass Cancel - Drop Copy - Reporting **How it is now-** - Market Data group: - Real Time Market Data - Market Data Snapshot - Trading group: - Place Order - Cancel Order - Modify Order - Replace Order - Mass Cancel - Drop Copy group: - Execution Reports - Mass Order Status - Trades - Reporting group: - Orders History - Trades History **MP Group** **How it was-** - Market Data - Drop Copy - Reporting **How it is now-** - Market Data group: - Real Time Market Data - Market Data Snapshot - Drop Copy group: - Execution Reports - Mass Order Status - Trades - Reporting group: - Orders History - Trades History ## 2022-09-13 - New Operations API allows to: - Capture Trade entry - Cancel Trade - Set settlement prices - Instrument object is now changed and now includes more optional fields ## 2022-08-31 - New APIs: - MPs API - MP Groups API ## 2021-06-29 - Instrument symbol can now contains .(dot) and -(hyphen) - Calendar.tradingDays is now optional to allow auctions only trading schedule. ## April 2021 - Initial version of API released.

item.name: Authentication API

request.description:
#### Request Parameters

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| email | Email provided by Exberry team |
| Password | Password provided by Exberry team |

#### Response Parameters

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| token | Token to be used for any API call |
| expiresIn | Expiration time in seconds |

#### Error Codes

| Code | Message |
| --- | --- |
| 2 | Wrong email or password |
| 10000 | Please login to Admin Application before using API |

item.description:
Any Admin API access will be provided an email and password.
Each email is assigned with the relevant permissions.

Before sending any request to Admin API, consumer needs to authenticate by calling the "Get Token" API and  receiving `token`.

This token should be used as Authorization (Bearer Token) for all other API methods.
Token expiration time is sent in the response along with token, need to regenerate the token when expiry time reached.

item.name: Instruments API

request.description:
This API allows to create a new instrument. ID will be returned in the response, this ID is the unique identifier of the instrument and should be used when sending update commands. Note: this ID can be retrieved via Get Instruments API. #### Create Instrument- Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | System is unavailable | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | `REMOVED v1.37.0`
`~~NEW v1.36.0~~`
~~100~~ | ~~legPriceBands \[value\] is not supported~~ | | 101 | \[FieldName\] not found | | 101 | \[FieldName\] must be less than or equal to maxLong/10^ fieldPrecision | | 101 | \[FieldName\] must be more than or equal to minLong/10^ fieldPrecision | | 101 | Precision of \[Fieldname\] is greater than \[quantityPrecision\] | | 101 | Precision of \[Fieldname\] is greater than \[pricePrecision\] | | 101 | Precision of quantityIncrement must be \[quantityPrecision\] (quantityPrecision) | | 101 | minQuantity should be less than maxQuantity or equal to it | | 101 | minPrice should be less than maxPrice or equal to it | | 101 | maxQuantity should be less than maxDepth or equal to it | | 101 | Stop Date must be after Start Date | | 101 | Stop date must be in future | | 101 | underlyingInstrumentId/legsInstrumentIds not found | | 101 | Legs \[price/quantity\] precision must be equal to strategy price precision | | `REMOVED v1.36.0`

Note: this validation relevant only for active instruments | Legs and Strategy calendars must be the same | | 2603 | \[fieldName\] of \[fieldValue\] is not allowed as instrument price precision is \[instrumentPricePrecision\] | | 2605 | \[FieldName\] must be less than maxLong/10^ pricePrecision | | 10001 | Permission denied |

You should remove some depth or decrease the quantity precision~~ | | `NEW v1.30.0` 2402 | Mass cancellation must be done before changing quantityPrecision | | `NEW v1.30.0` 2402 | Mass cancellation must be done before changing pricePrecision | | 10001 | Permission denied |

request.description: This API allows to get a single instrument details.

This API allows to archiving of existing instrument Please contact the Exberry team if you would like to enable it on your system. In order to support a large number of instruments we introduce the ability to archive instruments. This is an irreversible operation that should happen only in case the instrument is no longer in use permanently. When an instrument is archived, you can still access historical financial information about it, including Orders, Order events, Trades, and Ops reports. You can also create a new instrument with the same symbol, but the archived instrument is no longer tradable. Archived instruments will be served only in those places: - Reporting - Orders - Orders event - Trades - Operations - Reporting API: - v1/exchange.reporting/mp/orders - v2/exchange.reporting/mp/trades In all other APIs, archived instruments will not be served. Prior to archiving an instrument, it must first be disabled, in case this instrument is a leg of a strategy, the parent must be archived prior to its legs. #### Archive Instrument- Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | Exchange is unavailable | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | 101 | \[FieldName\] not found | | 102 | Disable the instrument before attempting to archive it | | 106 | Archiving strategy \[parentSymbol\] is required | | `NEW v1.34.0`
107
Note: This validation will only take effect after the first update for that instrument. | This instrument is underlying instrument of \[Derivative Symbol\] | | 10001 | Permission denied |

item.description:
Instruments API allows you to: - Get single instrument details - Get the list of all instruments with their details - Create an instrument - Update existing instruments - `NEW v1.30` Archive an instrument that is no longer in use Samples for both mandatory fields only and all fields can be found in the `Get Instrument` section `REMOVED v1.36.0` ~~In order to override the auction setup in calendar level and in case that instrument should have its own setup, auction object can be added to instrument object.~~ ~~Otherwise the instrument will have its calendar auction setup.~~ #### Instrument Object - Mandatory Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Int String | Instrument ID (Not part of request body in Create/ Update Instrument) | | symbol | String | Unique Symbol of the instrument. Max length - 16, contains \[a-Z,0-9,-,.,^,=,\] | | quoteCurrency | String | Quote currency | | calendarId | Int String | Calendar ID | | pricePrecision | Int String | Allowed decimal places for price. Max value: 10 | | quantityPrecision | Int String | Allowed decimal places for quantity. Max value: 10 | | minQuantity | Decimal String | Min order size | | maxQuantity | Decimal String | Max order size | | activityStatus | String | ACTIVE: trading allowed
DISABLED: Trading not allowed
ARCHIVED: Can't be used in Create/ Update APIs but only in the Get APIs, for more details see [here](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/6229811/TzCV3jcq#a4a29f01-55ed-47a9-85f7-5db4e8d0026f) | | `REMOVED v1.28.0` ~~tradingStatus~~ | ~~String~~ | ~~TRADE: Instrument is trading
HALT: Instrument is halted~~ | | `REMOVED v1.28.0`
~~marketStatus~~ | ~~String~~ | ~~Opened: Market is open
Closed: Market is closed
AuctionCall: Instrument is in Auction Call
AuctionCrossing: Instrument is in Auction Crossing~~ | | description | String | Instrument Description | #### Instrument Object - Optional Fields Optional fields should be omitted from request if not required | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | maxDepth | Decimal String | Maximum allowed depth (for both buy and sell) for the instrument | | maxOrderValue | Decimal String | Maximum allowed order value for the instrument in quote currency terms | | maxPrice | Decimal String | Maximum allowed price for the instrument | | minPrice | Decimal String | Minimum allowed price for the instrument | | quantityIncrement | Decimal String | Order quantity must be multiplied by the quantity increment | | tickSizeTableId | Int String | Tick size table ID | | `(NEW v1.42.0)`
groupIds | \[\]Int String | Optional
A list of group Ids. | | category | Char | Instrument
A table of available values is listed below | | subCategory | Char | Instrument sub category
A table of available values is listed below | | underlyingAssets | Char | Instrument underlying assets type
A table of available values is listed below | | cfi | String (6 chars ) | CFI code | | mic | String (4 chars ) | MIC code | | startDate | Unix time (sec) | Mandatory if Category = O (option) OR F (Futures)
Used for derivatives, trading is allowed from this time.

`(NEW v1.40.0)` Before this time, marketStatus is in Closed state without changing as per the calendar. | | stopDate | Unix time (sec) | Mandatory if Category = O (option) OR F (Futures)
Used for derivatives, trading is allowed up to this time.
At this time all active orders are being cancelled.`(REMOVED v1.34.0)` ~~instrument status changed to be Disabled~~
`(NEW v1.34.0)` See tradingCutoffs for instrument expiration details

item.description:
Instrument groups allows users to manage instrument grouping with few levels of hierarchy. This is internal feature allow exchange operators to group instruments as needed (this information is not published to participants/ traders anywhere). After creating the groups, an instrument can be added and removed to/ from a group. Instrument Groups API allows you to: - Get single Instrument Group details - Get the list of all instrument Groups with their details - Create an Instrument Group - Update an existing Instrument Group #### Instrument Group Object | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Int String | Instrument Group ID
(Not part of the request body of Create Instrument Group) | | name | String | Name of the Group
May contain values that are not unique

Max length - 30 chars and can contain ASCII (32 -126) | | parentGroupId | Int String | Optional
Parent Group ID |

Note: this ID can be retrieved via Get Calendars API. #### Create Calendar- Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | System is unavailable | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | 101 | Holiday date should not be sent twice | | 101 | Wrong holiday close time | | 101 | name already exists | | `NEW v1.33.0`
101 | IOC TIF is allowed only for Equilibrium Price | | `NEW v1.35.0`
101 | AutoResume auction is required by \[CBRName\] CBR | | 10001 | Permission denied | | 10005 | Not found | | 20000 | Calendar Name already exists | | 20001 | Wrong format | | 20002 | Wrong format | #### Auction - Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | System is unavailable | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | 101 | Auction start must be after previous auction end | | 101 | randomEndTime / 2 must be less than duration | | 101 | Wrong duration and randomEndTime | | \[REMOVED 1.42.0\]~~
101~~ | ~~One side must contain single mpId~~ | | 101 | \[fieldName\] is relevant only for timeBased auction | | 101 | Only single auction can be configured with \[fieldName\] trigger | | 101 | overrideReferencePrice can be True only for equilibrium price algorithm | | 101 | AutoResume auction is required by \[CBRName\] CBR | | 101 | IOC TIF is allowed only for Equilibrium Price | | `NEW v1.38.0`

item.description:
Calendars API allows you to: - Get single calendar details - Get the list of all calendars with their details - Create a calendar - Update existing calendars - Trigger EOD for a specific calendar #### Calendar Object - Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Int String | Calendar ID (Not part of request body in Create/ Update Calendar) | | tradingDays `optional` | String\[\] | List of days in week that trading is allowed | | name | String | Unique Calendar name | | timeZone | String | Time zone difference from UTC. This affects all the dates and times in the calendar
samples: "+03:00", "-02:00" | | marketOpen `optional` | hh:mm String | Start trading hour, inclusive | | marketClose `optional` | hh:mm String | End trading hour, mandatory in case marketOpen is sent | | holidays `optional` | holiday\[\] | Optional, list of holidays | | auctions `optional` | auction\[\] | Optional, list of auctions setup | #### Holiday Object Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | date | YYYY-MM-DD String | Holiday date | | closeTime `optional` | hh:mm String | Early close hour | | name `optional` | String | Holiday name | #### Auction Object Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | trigger `optional` | eNum | When the auction is triggered.

Allowed values:
\* **TimeBased** (default)- for regular auction schedule that is based on date and time (you can have many auctions with that trigger)
\* **Resume-** for auctions that will be triggered as a result of manual resume operation by system operator who will click “Resume” button, or by scheduled resume (you can have only one auction per calendar with that trigger)
\* **AutoResume-** for auctions that will be triggered as a result of automatic resume operation by system as part of CBR. This can happen in case of a temporary halt that is being configured in Circuit Breaker Rule. (you can have only one auction per calendar with that trigger) | | days `optional` | String\[\] | List of days in week that auctions will start
**Mandatory** if trigger = TimeBased | | startTimes `optional` | hh:mm:ss String\[\] | List of start time for the auction in terms of calendar time zone
**Mandatory** if trigger = TimeBased
\[NEW 1.21.0\] Auction objects are sorted by ascending order of this field. | | allowedTimeInForces | String\[\] | List of allowed TIF, available values: GTC, GTD, GAA, DAY , `NEW v1.33.0` IOC, `(NEW v1.41.0)` OPG and ATC.
Note: IOC behaves like GAA but allows the use of market orders during the auction.

Refer [here](https://docs.exberry.io/other/business-features/time-in-force) for more details. | | matchingAlgorithm | String | Auction matching algorithm, available values:
**PRICE_AND_TIME**: execution based on price and time priority
**EQUILIBRIUM_PRICE**: execution based on single calculated equilibrium price
\[NEW 1.29.0\] **EQUILIBRIUM_PRICE_2**: execution based on single calculated equilibrium price

Note: Contact Exberry to get more details on the exact price calculation. | | eventsModes | String\[\] | List of events to be published during auction in `orderBookDepth`:
**LIT**: regular order events
**INDICATIVE_PRICE**: AuctionIndicativeEP events | | \[REMOVED 1.36.0\]
~~indicativePriceFrequency~~ | ~~String~~ | ~~Frequency for publishing~~ `~~AuctionIndicativeEP~~` ~~events in milliseconds.
Mandatory in case eventsModes includes~~ ~~**Indicative Price**~~ | | duration | Int String | Auction duration in milliseconds | | randomEndTime | Int String | Auction random end time in milliseconds. Time range in which auction ends. If specified, auction ends randomly in time range \[X - randomEndTime / 2; X + randomEndTime / 2\]
X = startTime + duration | | crossingPause | Int String | Auction crossing pause is a time range which will delay the crossing(executions) time from start in milliseconds. During this time - no orders commands can be sent. | | \[REMOVED 1.42.0\]
~~auctionType~~ | ~~String~~ | ~~Auction type, available values:
~~**MANY_TO_MANY**~~: All participants can place bids and offers
~~**ONE_TO_MANY**~~: Single participant can place bid/ offer per setup in the below fields, counter side is open for all participants. In such case~~ `~~buyMpList~~` ~~or~~ `~~sellMpList~~` ~~must contain single MP~~ | | \[REMOVED 1.42.0\]
~~buyMpList~~ `~~optional~~` | ~~Int\[\]~~ | ~~List of mpId that are allowed to place buy orders.
Do not send this field if all mp are allowed~~ | | \[REMOVED 1.42.0\]
~~sellMpList~~ `~~optional~~` | ~~Int\[\]~~ | ~~List of mpId that are allowed to place sell orders.
Do not send this field if all mp are allowed~~ | | overrideReferencePrice `optional` | boolean | Whether to refer to the auction equilibrium price as refrence price to daily price bands.
relevant only when matchingAlgorithm = `EQUILIBRIUM_PRICE`
Note: empty means false. | | \[NEW 1.29.0\] extensions `optional` | extensions \[\] | Optional
List of extensions | #### \[NEW 1.29.0\] #### extensions Object Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | criticalPhase | Int String | Critical phase in milliseconds where auction will be checked if needs to be extended | | timeFrom | Int String | Specify the extension time start in milliseconds | | timeTo | Int String | Specify the extension time end in milliseconds

In case timeTo > timeFrom , extension will be randomly selected within that range (include timeTo & timeFrom) | **Samples for both with and without auctions can be found on** **`Get Calendar`** **section** ---

item.name: apiKey

request.description:
This API allows to create a new apiKey for a specific MP. As a response system will generate pair of apiKey and secret key. For your security, your API Secret will only be returned at the time it is created. If you lose it, you will need to delete your API key and set up a new one. #### Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | System is unavailable | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | 101 | \[FieldName\] not found | | 102 | label already exists | | `(REMOVED v1.43.0)`
60002 | Allowed and blocked instruments/`(NEW v1.42.0)` instrumentGroups can not be filled for a single apiKey |

This API allows to update an existing apiKey for a specific MP.  

`secret` is being generated when apiKey is created and can never be changed.

item.description:
apiKeys API allows you to:

- Get single apiKey details
    
- Get the list of all apiKeys for specific MP Group with their details
    
- Create apiKey
    
- (NEW v1.43.0) Update API Key
    
- Delete existing apiKey
    

apiKey Object

|  | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| label | String | apiKey label, max length =64 |
| apiKey | String | apiKey |
| secret | String | secret key |
| mpGroupId | int String | MP ID |
| permissions | \[\]eNum | Permissions grantted for the apiKey. A table of available values is listed below |

| Permission Category | Permission API | Permission |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Market Data group | market-service:market:market_data | FIX Market Data |
| Market Data group | market-service:market:order_book_depth | Real Time Market Data |
| Market Data group | market-service:market:order_book_state | Market Data Snapshot |
| Drop Copy group | market-service:market:execution_reports | Execution Reports |
| Drop Copy group | market-service:market:mass_order_status | Mass Order Status |
| Drop Copy group | market-service:market:trades | Trades |
| Reporting group | reporting:mp:orders | Orders History |
| Reporting group | reporting:mp:trades | Trades History |

item.description:
MP Group allows you to configure read only access for group of market participants (or all of them).

MP Groups API allows you to:

- Get single MP Group details
    
- Get the list of all MP Groups with their details
    
- Create MP Group
    
- Update existing MP Group
    

MP Group Object

| Field | Type | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| id | Int String | MP Group ID (Not part of request body in Create/ Update MP Group) |
| name | String | Unique MP Group Name, max length =50 charecters and ASCII (32 -126) chars only |
| compId `optional` | String | Unique compId to be configured on FIX connection for that MP Group. Max length = 16 and ASCII (32 -126) chars only |
| mpIds `optional` | \[\]Int String | List of MPs that this group contains, for all MPs, do not send this property. |

MP Group can has multiple sets of apiKeys to access system, see  
[here](#0860c6f5-0ddd-46f6-a5db-fb7f5b8c0bb7) for apiKey details.

item.name: CBR API

request.description:
This API allows to create a new CBR. ID will be returned in the response, this ID is the unique identifier of the CBR and should be used when sending update commands. Note: this ID can be retrieved via Get CBRs API. #### Create CBR - Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | System is unavailable | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | `NEW v1.42.0`
100 | Only one of instrumentIds and instrumentGroupIds is allowed | | 101 | \[FieldName\] not found | | 102 | name already exists | | `REMOVED v1.37`
`NEW v1.35.0` ~~104~~ | ~~The calendar was copied successfully with the auctions from original calendar~~ | | `NEW v1.35.0` 104 | only Resume Auction is allowed for this CBR type | | `NEW v1.35.0` 104 | AutoResume auction needs to be configured with override reference price | | 105 | Priority \[value\] already exists | | 10001 | Permission denied |

This API allows to update existing CBR.

#### Update CBR - Error Codes

All validations in create CBR

| **Code** | Message |
| --- | --- |
| 101 | \[FieldName\] not found |
| 10001 | Permission denied |
This API allows to get CBRs details.
This API allows to get a single CBR details.

item.description:
Circuit Breaker Rules (CBR) API allows you to: - Get single CBR details - Get the list of all CBRs with their details - Create a CBR - Update existing CBRs #### CBR Object - Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Int String | CBR ID (Not part of request body in Create/ Update CBR) | | name | String | Unique CBR name | | instrumentIds | \[\]int | List of instrument ids to apply this rule
If empty - apply this rule for all instruments | | `NEW v1.42.0`
instrumentGroupIds | \[\]Int | List of instrument group ids to apply this rule
Note: Only one of instrumentIds and instrumentGroupIds is allowed | | status | eNum | Available values:
ACTIVE - CBR is active
DISABLED - CBR is not active | | type | eNum | Available values:
MARKET_RATE - monitor market rate changes since the previous day's close rate or daily settlement price if exists.
`NEW`DYNAMIC_MARKET_RATE - monitor market rate changes since the previous trade rate (last price)
`NEW v1.35.0` MARKET_RATE_POTENTIAL_EXECUTION - monitor potential executions that may impact market rate changes since the previous day's close rate or daily settlement price if exists.
`NEW v1.35.0`
DYNAMIC_MARKET_RATE_POTENTIAL_EXECUTION - monitor potential executions that may impact market rate changes since the previous trade rate (last price) | | value | Decimal | The value in percent that considered breach (value > 1 means increase on rate and 0 < value < 1 means decline rate) Example:
0.8 means decline of 20%
1.2 means increase of 20% | | actionType | eNum | Available values:
HALT_TRADING - halt the trading for the instrument
NOTIFY_BACKOFFICE - send notification to Admin users
`NEW`RESUME_AUCTION - will trigger the auto_resume_auction | | actionValue | Decimal | “HALT_TRADING” - If empty - halt the trading for that instrument permanently (can only be resumed manually) Else time in minutes.
“NOTIFY_BACKOFFICE” - always empty
`NEW`“RESUME_AUCTION” - always empty | | priority | Int | Rule priority - the highest is more important. | | `NEW V1.26.0` rounding | eNum | Available values:
NONE: default, Do not round
UP: Round up using both price precision and tick size table
DOWN: Round down using both price precision and tick size table | #### NEW Edge Case- In case there are more then one event that need to trigger CBR, we will send the trigger just once, at the end. example- ``` For a regular order flow closing/settlement price is 90, CBR -> type = MARKET_RATE, actionType = HALT_TRADING value = 1.1 (increase of 10%) Orderbook: bids: 98,101,102,103,104 -> qty = 1 (for each order) a SELL taker order is coming along with 5 qty and market price events: execution 104 execution 103 execution 102 execution 101 execution 98 Halted ```

item.name: Tick Size API

request.description:
This API allows to create a new TickSize.

ID will be returned in the response, this ID is the unique identifier of the TickSize and should be used when sending update commands.

Note: this ID can be retrieved via Get TickSizes API.

#### Create TickSize- Error Codes

| Code | Message |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | System is unavailable |
| 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] |
| 101 `new` | Max number of ticksizes (items) is 25 |
| 102 | name already exists |
| 10001 | Permission denied |

This API allows to update existing TickSize. #### Update TickSize - Error Codes All validations in create TickSize and the below | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 101 | \[FieldName\] not found | | 10001 | Permission denied | | 10004 | Wrong format | | 2605 | \[FieldName\] must be less than maxLong/10^ pricePrecision for \[Instrument\] | | 2603 | \[fieldValue\] is not allowed as price precision is \[lowestinstrumentPricePrecision\] for \[Instrument\]
|
This API allows to get TickSizes details.
This API allows to get a single TickSize details.

TickSize API allows you to: - Get single TickSize details - Get the list of all TickSizes with their details - Create a TickSize - Update existing TickSize #### TickSize Object - Fields View More | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Int String | Tick Size ID (Not part of request body in Create/ Update TickSize) | | name | String | Unique TickSize name
Max length is 30 | | items | items\[\] | list of items

(NEW v1.40.0)
items are stored after sorting by their prices(ascending order) | #### Items Object Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | price | String | Price to- use the price when order price ≤ to this price and > from previous price (this array need to be sorted).
If empty this will apply to all order prices above the previous price. | | tickSize | Decimal | Tick size to be used for current price level |

request.description:
Apply Cash Distribution API allows you to adjust active orders and current market data fields(not historical) in case of a Corporate Actions that results cash distributions (such as cash dividend). #### **Request Parameters:** | **Field** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | instrumentId | Stringfied number | Instrument ID to apply the cash distribution | | amount | Stringfied Decimal | Cash Amount per share

Maximum 10 decimal places | #### **Response:** | **Field** | Description | | --- | --- | | numberOfOrders | The total number of active/suspended orders for the instrument before applying the corporate action | | numberOfNewOrders | The number of new orders generated for the corporate action | | numberOfCancelledOrders | The number of cancelled orders for the corporate action | #### Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | System is unavailable | | 10001 | Permission denied | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | 100 | \[FieldName\] must be ≤ \[maxLong/10^ fieldPrecision\] | | 100 | \[FieldName\] must be ≥ \[minLong/10^ fieldPrecision\] | | 102 | Instrument trading is not allowed | | 102 | Trading is not allowed during auction call | | 102 | Trading is not allowed during crossing | | 102 | Instrument should be halted when market is open | | 102 | Apply Cash Distribution is not allowed when there is no Closing Price |

request.description:
Get Candle Adjustments API allows you to retrieve the historical market data adjustment factors related to Corporate Actions at instrument level. #### Request Parameters | **Field** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | dateFrom | Stringfied Date | Optional
Search for the CAs that exDate ≥ dateFrom. Format:YYYY-MM-DD | | dateTo | Stringfied Date | Optional
Search for the CAs that exDate < dateTo
Format: YYYY-MM-DD | | instrumentId | Stringfied Int | Optional

Instrument Id | | orderBy | Enum | Optional
object with 2 parameters:
field (String)
direction (Asc, Desc) direction

If nothing or invalid field was sent the default is \[exDate, Desc\] | | limit | Stringfied Int | Optional
How many records to include in each page
If nothing was sent default is 25
Max value = 100 | | offset | Stringfied Int | Optional
Which record to start send from (if you want page 3 and there are 50 records per page offset should be 150)
If nothing was sent default is 0 (=first record) | #### **Response:** | Attribute | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | count | Stringfied Int | total number of records based on filter | | List of adjustmentFactors | | | | instrumentId | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | | exDate | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | | price | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | | quantity | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | Same as Update Candle Adjustments | #### Error Codes Same as Update Candle Adjustments

request.description:
Mass Cancel API allows you to mass cancel pending activity per request critirias: Request Parameters | **Field** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | instrumentId | Stringfied number | Instrument ID to mass cancel the orders | | `Removed v1.30.0`
~~comment~~ | ~~String~~ | ~~Free text comment~~ | | mpId | Stringfied number | `Optional`
MP ID to mass cancel the target entities
Not sending this parameter will mass cancel for all MPs | | targetParties | \[\]TargetParty objects | `Optional`

targetParties to target the mass cancel orders.
If multiple targetParty objects are in a request, the system cancels orders with all targetParties.
For example:
Order1 has party1
Order2 has party1 and party2
Order3 has party1, party2 and party3
Order4 has no parties
A mass cancel request with targetParties(party1 and party2) will cancel order 2 and 3.

Note: For accounts: id=accountId, source=D, role=1001. | | `(NEW 1.30.0)` targetEntities | \[\] Enum | `Optional`

The system cancels the type of active entities mentioned in the request.

Array of below values:
Order - cancels all orders
RFQ - cancels all RFQs and all active quotes belong to them
Quote - cancels all Quotes
`(NEW v1.31.0)` AllegedTrade - cancels all Alleged Trades

If not exist, system considers as targetEntities = \[‘Order’\] | | `(NEW 1.31.0)` targetScope | Enum | The field specifies the scope the mass cancel request applies to

Allowed values:
Instrument - cancel scope is a single instrument
All - cancel scope is all instruments

If not sent “Instrument” is considered. | | `(NEW 1.32.0)`
cancelReason | Enum | Optional
Cancellation reason. (populated in the cancellation events)

Allowed values:
MassCancelOnBehalf (default if nothing is sent)
MassCancelRequest
CorporateAction | ##### NEW **TargetParty specification:** | **Field** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | id | string | TargetParty id | | source | char | TargetParty source | | role | int | TargetParty role | #### Mass Cancel- Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 2001 | Wrong action | | 2001 | Wrong instrumentIds | | 2401 | Wrong instrumentId: \[instrumentId\] | | 403 | Permission denied |

Set Settlement Price API allows you to set settlement price for an instrument #### Set Settlement Prices - Request Fields | **Field** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | instrumentId | string | Instrument ID to set a Settlement Price | | price | string | The price to set | | `NEW v1.34.0`

default is True | #### Set Settlement Prices - Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | Exchange is unavailable | | 100 | Missing or invalid parameter: \[FieldName\] | | 101 | instrumentId not found | | 102 | Currently not allowed | | 10001 | Permission denied |

Trading Halt API allows you to halt the trading for a: - List of instrument - `NEW v1.42.0` List of instrument groups - All instruments - `NEW v1.30.0` Multiple filtered instruments, see [here](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/6229811/TzCV3jcq#c1b23770-4cc1-41b0-a035-15f3e280bbe4) for more details | **Field** | **Type** | **Description** | | --- | --- | --- | | instrumentIds | \[\] Stringified numbers | `Optional`
List of instruments to halt
Note: not sending this parameter will halt the trading for all instruments | | `NEW v1.42.0`
instrumentGroupIds | \[\] Stringified numbers | `Optional`List of instrument groups to halt | | `NEW v1.35.0`scheduleResumeTime | Unix time (sec) | `Optional`
When to resume trading | | `NEW v1.35.0`
scheduleResumetTimeInterval | Int String | `Optional`
When to resume trading in minutes
Interval | #### `NEW v1.35.0` Schedule Resume When setting a HALT, you can specify when trading will resume in two ways: (If none of the above sent, the system won't perform a resume until a manual resume.) ##### **Time Interval Extension-** During the halt operation, you can specify a time interval in which trading will be resumed. For example, now it's 2:00 p.m. and a user clicks on halt with a time interval of 10 minutes, trading will resume at 2:10 p.m. Sending a new halt request with a new time interval extension will add the new time to the old request time. For example, in addition to the previous example, at 2:07 p.m. the user again clicks on halt with a time interval of 5 minutes, trading will resume at 2:15 p.m. (2:10 p.m. plus the 5 minutes from the latest request). The time will start counting only from the actual trading status change to halt. ##### **Explicit Time-** During the halt operation,you specified the explicit date & time to resume the trading. Halting instruments again that are currently pending for resume, set up new time to the resume. The request approval time in the maker checker does not affect the resume time. (does not depend on the approval time of the application) ##### **Combinations of both types:** - If a request is sent with an explicit time followed by a request with a time interval, the interval will be added to the original explicit time. For example, it's now 2:00 p.m., a request was sent for a resume at 4:30 p.m., and after that, a request was sent with a time interval extension of 10 minutes. The resume will be at 4:40 p.m. (does not depend on the approval time of the application unless it was approved after 4:30 p.m.) - If a request is sent with a time interval and then a request with an explicit time is submitted, the explicit time request will take precedence and be applied. **Manual immediate resume will always override previous setting and resume immediately.** #### Trading Halt - Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 2001 | Wrong action | | 2001 | Wrong instrumentIds | | `NEW v1.35.0`
2002 | \[FieldName\] must be in future | | `NEW v1.35.0`
2003 | Only one of scheduleResumeTime and scheduleResumeTimeInterval is allowed | | `Removed v1.42.0`
~~2004~~ | ~~Filters are not allowed when Maker-Checker is enabled~~ | | `NEW v1.42.0`
2401 | Wrong instrumentId: \[instrumentId\] | | 2401 | Wrong instrumentGroupIds: \[instrumentGroupId\] | | 403 | Permission denied | | `NEW v1.31.0`
201 | You can send up to 750 instruments per request |

item.name: Maker Checker

request.description:
For APIkey there are changes compared to the regular API (without make checker activated).

`mpId` and `mpGroupId`are replaced with:  
\- ownerType: MP/ MP_GROUP  
\- ownerId: Id of the owner of the api key

Those changes are also impact "Update API Key" API

item.description:
To activate this flow, please contact operations team. The maker-checker process is a workflow that requires the approval of at least two individuals to agree on an action. Breaking it down, this process involves two parties: - **Maker**: the person who initiates the action. (can always see its own requests and reject them) - **Checker**: the person who approves the action. (can’t approve its own request) When a user requests to do some action (like update or create an instrument), the change will not happen immediately (e.g. change won't be shown in the instrument list). The change will take place only after approval. For any action that is part of that flow, the user will have the ability to add comment describing this change so the checker can get the change context. | Name | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | comment | String | The comment of the maker, an explanation of what the action contains. | Super user with the right permission can override this flow. #### Response Fields Instead of the regular response messgae, any API request that is involved in that flow will result in `request` entity response. | Name | Description | | --- | --- | | id | The Id of the maker checker request | | data | Data model of the reuqest object (i.e. instrument details etc.) | | requestType | The type of the reuqest:
\- CreateInstrument
\- UpdateIntrument
\- CreateCalendar
\- UpdateCalendar
\- CreateMP
\- UpdateMP
\- CreateMPGroup
\- UpdateMPGroup
\- `NEW v1.42.0` CreateAPIKey
\- `NEW v1.43.0` UpdateAPIKey
\- `NEW v1.42.0` DeleteAPIKey
\- CreateCBR
\- UpdateCBR
\- CreateTickSize
\- UpdateTickSize
\- TradeEntry
\- TradeCancellation
\- SetSettlementPrice
\- Halt
\- Resume
\- MassCancel
\- EOD
\- CancelOrder
\- ArchiveInstrument
\- CreateAccount
\- UpdateAccount
\- CashDistributionAdjustment
\- SecurityDistributionAdjustment
\- UpdateCandleAdjustments
\- DeleteCandleAdjustments
\- `NEW v1.42.0` CreateInstrumentGroup
\- `NEW v1.42.0` UpdateInstrumentGroup | | name | Entity name | | status | The status of the request \[Pending/Approved/Canceled\] | | makerComment | The comment of the reuqest | | makerUserId | The user id of the reuqest | | makerUserType | The maker user type:
\- Admin
\- Exchange Trader | | timestamp | The time when the request was created
format: YYYT-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.SSSS | The `data` property contains the data model of the requested action, identical to the API specification for that action without maker checker activated. In case there is diffrent data model - it is explicitly specified in the samples below.

item.description:
Calendars API allows you to: - Get single calendar details - Get the list of all calendars with their details - Create a calendar - Update existing calendars - Trigger EOD for a specific calendar #### Calendar Object - Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | id | Int String | Instrument ID (Not part of request body in Create/ Update Calendar) | | tradingDays `optional` | String\[\] | List of days in week that trading is allowed | | name | String | Unique Calendar name | | timeZone | String | Time zone difference from UTC. This affects all the dates and times in the calendar
samples: "+03:00", "-02:00" | | marketOpen `optional` | hh:mm String | Start trading hour, inclusive | | marketClose `optional` | hh:mm String | End trading hour, mandatory in case marketOpen is sent | | holidays `optional` | holiday\[\] | Optional, list of holidays | | auctions `optional` | auction\[\] | Optional, list of auctions setup | #### Holiday Object Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | date | YYYY-MM-DD String | Holiday date | | closeTime `optional` | hh:mm String | Early close hour | | name `optional` | String | Holiday name | #### Auction Object Fields | Field | Type | Description | | --- | --- | --- | | `new` Trigger `optional` | eNum | When the auction is triggered
allowed values:
\* **TimeBased** (default)- for regular auction schedule that is based on date and time (you can have many auctions with that trigger)
\* **Resume-** for auctions that will be triggered as a result of manual resume operation by system operator that will click “Resume” button (you can have only one auction per calendar with that trigger)
\* **AutoResume-** for auctions that will be triggered as a result of automatic resume operation by system. This can happen in case of a temporary halt that is being configured in Circuit Breaker Rule. (you can have only one auction per calendar with that trigger) | | days `optional` | String\[\] | List of days in week that auctions will start
**Mandatory** if trigger = TimeBased | | startTimes `optional` | hh:mm String\[\] | List of start time for the auction in terms of calendar time zone
**Mandatory** if trigger = TimeBased | | allowedTimeInForces | String\[\] | List of allowed TIF, available values: GTC, GTD and GAA | | matchingAlgorithm | String | Auction matching algorithm, available values:
**Price & Time**: execution based on price and time priority
**Equilibrium Price**: execution based on single calculated equilibrium price | | eventsMode | String\[\] | List of events to be published during auction in `orderBookDepth`:
**LIT**: regular order events
**Indicative Price**: AuctionIndicativeEP events | | indicativePriceFrequency.untit | String | Indicative price frequencyh(hours)/ m(minutes)/ s(seconds)/ ms(milliseconds) | | indicativePriceFrequency.value | String | Frequency for publishing `AuctionIndicativeEP` events.
Mandatory in case eventsMode includes **Indicative Price** | | duration.unit | String | Auction duration unit, h(hours)/ m(minutes)/ s(seconds)/ ms(milliseconds) | | duration.value | Int String | Auction duration value | | randomEndTime.unit | String | Auction random end time unit, h(hours)/ m(minutes)/ s(seconds)/ ms(milliseconds) | | randomEndTime.value | Int String | Auction random end time value. Time range in which auction ends. If specified, auction ends randomly in time range \[X - randomEndTime / 2; X + randomEndTime / 2\]
X = startTime + duration | | crossingPause.unit | String | Auction crossing pause unit, h(hours)/ m(minutes)/ s(seconds)/ ms(milliseconds) | | crossingPause.value | Int String | Auction crossing pause value is a time range which will delay the crossing(executions) time from start. During this time - no orders commands can be sent. | | auctionType | String | Auction type, available values:
**Many To Many**: All participants can place bids and offers
**One To Many**: Single participant can place bid/ offer per setup in the below fields, counter side is open for all participants. In such case `buyMpList` or `sellMpList` must contain single MP | | buyMpList | Int\[\] | List of mpId that are allowed to place buy orders.
Do not send this field if all mp are allowed | | sellMpList | Int\[\] | List of mpId that are allowed to place sell orders.
Do not send this field if all mp are allowed | **Samples for both with and without auctions can be found on** **`Get Calendar`** **section** #### End Of Day - Error Codes | Code | Message | | --- | --- | | 1 | Exchange is unavailable | | 101 | \[FieldName\] not found | | 102 | EOD is not allowed | | 10001 | Permission denied | ---

# Migration to V2

All instrument and calendar realted API methods were moved to version 2 of the API (v2 was added to API path).  
You can find the V1 documentation under archive folder.

Version 2 contains the below changes:

- Instrument API
    
    - New parameters added to the response:
        
        - tradingStatus
            
        - marketStatus
            
    - Parameters name changes:
        
        - status -> activityStatus
            
        - tickSizeGroupId -> tickSizeTableId
            
    - Response is now object that conatains array of instruments
        
- Calendar API
    
    - Changed from Sentence case to UPPERCASE (From Monday to MONDAY)
        
        - tradingDays
            
        - auction.days
            
        - auction.matchingAlgorithm
            
        - auction.auctionType
            
    - eventsMode changed to be eventsModes
        
    - startTimes now include seconds
        
    - Below parameters used to be built from `unit` and `value` and now are always in milliseconds terms
        
        - duration
            
        - randomEndTime
            
        - crossingPause
            
        - indicativePriceFrequency
            

# Archived Introduction Feb 2025

## General

Exberry admin API allows to manage the exchange static data (instruments, trading calendars and more) as well as sending operational commands (EOD, halt trading and more).

Sandbox environment endpoint (`URL_ORIGIN`): `https://admin-api.uat.exberry-uat.io`

Guidelines:

- All numbers are stringified unless explicitly mentioned otherwise
    
- Optional fields should be omitted from request if not required
    
- System ignores any additional parameter that are sent on request body but was not specified in this document
    

`NEW` Note: There is an option to enable the maker checker flow for some of the Admin actions. More information can be seen in the relevant section.

---

#### Error Handling

Error response contains the below fields:

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| code | Error code |
| message | Error message |
| path `optional` | path for the specific field generate the error |
| requiredPermission `optional` | Name of missing permission for that action |
| instrumentId `optional` | InstrumentId cause the error, relevant for action that affect multiple instruments such as Update Calendar |

Error response sample:

``` json
{
    "code": 10004,
    "message": "Wrong format",
    "data": {
        "path": [
            "id"
        ]
    }
}

 ```

In case of wrong path, generic error will be returned:

``` json
{
    "message": "Route not found",
    "code": 1
}

 ```

#### Generic Error Codes

| Code | Message |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | Timeout expired/ Exchange is unavailable/ Invalid JSON/ Route not found |
| `NEW v1.31.0` 1 | Maximum request size is 60kb |
| 10000 | Invalid token |
| 10100 | Permission denied for exchange \[ExchangeID\] |

#### Multiple Exchanges

By default the Admin API apply the commands based on the user default setup.  
In case that single user needs to use the API for multiple exchange, `exchangeId` (approved for this user) can be provided as an optional property in a request as follow:

\* GET requests: included in the query string (?exchangeId=XYZ)  
\* POST & PUT request: included in request body ({ ..., exchangeId: XYZ})

---
